articles.title: Indonesian President Hosts Banquet in Honor of Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Indonesian President Hosts Banquet in Honor of Kim Yong Nam
 Jakarta, May 15 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Indonesian President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono hosted a banquet in honor of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, at the Presidential Palace in Jakarta on Tuesday.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Nam, Ri Kwang Gun, chairman of the Commission for Joint Venture and Investment, An Jong Su, minister of Light Industry of the DPRK, and other suite members, Ambassador Ri Jong Ryul and staff members of the DPRK embassy there.
					
					 Present there were Djoko Suyanto, coordinating minister for Political and Law, Security Affairs, Hatta Radjasa, coordinating minister for Economic Affairs, Agung Laksono, coordinating minister for People's Welfare, Foreign Minister Raden Mohammad Marty Muliana Natalegawa, ministers of Trade, Defense and Industry of Indonesia, Taufiq Kiemas, speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly, Marzuki Alie, speaker of the People's Representatives, the commander-in-chief of the Indonesian National Army, the chief of the Supreme Court, Nasri Gustaman, Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK, and officials concerned.
					
					 The Indonesian president said in his speech at the banquet President Kim Il Sung would be always alive in the hearts of the two peoples.
					
					 He expressed his belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would grow stronger as they have been consolidated and developed in the interests of the two governments and peoples.
					
					 Kim in his speech wished the Indonesian people bigger success in their efforts to build a new prosperous society.
					
					 He also hoped Indonesia would make a positive contribution to ensuring regional peace and stability and boosting unity and cooperation among developing countries.
					
					 A performance was given by Indonesian artistes at the banquet.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Learns about Work at Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Learns about Work at Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, learned about the work at the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex on the spot on Tuesday.
					 The workers of the complex are making achievements in updating it and producing heavy-duty rails true to the behests of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Going round gas generation and high temperature air combustion heating process and various other places, the premier learned in detail about the progress made in updating the complex and held a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issues of implementing the WPK's policy on modernizing railways and replacing the existing rails with heavy-duty ones, pushing forward the updating of the complex and keeping rail production going at a high rate. It took measures to ensure that relevant units satisfactorily ensure the supply of raw and other materials needed for production.
					
					 The premier got familiar with the management and operation of the hostel and supply service.
					
					 Stressing the need for the officials to provide the workers with convenience on a priority basis and take good care of their living, by learning from the dear respected Kim Jong Un's noble outlook on the people. He took measures to complete the construction of dwelling houses as early as possible.
					
					 The premier also visited the 15th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair on the same day. He underlined the need to positively develop the bilateral and multilateral cooperation among countries and regions in the economic and trade fields.

articles.title: Second-Phase Project for Kwaksan Tideland Reclamation and Setups in Reclaimed Taegyedo Tideland Completed
articles.content:
Second-Phase Project for Kwaksan Tideland Reclamation and Setups in Reclaimed Taegyedo Tideland Completed 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The second-phase project for Kwaksan Tideland reclamation and setups in the reclaimed Taegyedo Tideland were completed in the DPRK. 
					 Workers and officials of the North Phyongan Province Tideland Reclamation Complex built breakwaters in sections extending several  thousand meters linking Kwan, Talyang, Woejang and several other islets in a matter of one and half years, turning 1 600 hectares of tideland into cultivated land. 
					
					 The completion of the projects made it possible for a huge farm to do safe farming and breed fishes and cultivate shallow-sea food. As a result, great progress was made in developing agriculture and improving people's living standard and another change was made in the map of the country. 
					
					 A ceremony of the completion of the projects took place on the spot Wednesday.
					
					  Present there were Choe Yong Rim, Ro Tu Chol and other officials concerned, officials and builders of the tideland reclamation complex and working people in Kwaksan County. 
					
					 A letter of thanks from the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee was conveyed to the builders and officials, scientists and technicians who made distinguishing labor feats in the construction of the second-phase project. 
					
					 The WPK Central Committee highly praised them for successfully building another monumental structure in the Songun era by displaying popular heroism and matchless devotion. 
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, the participants went round different places of the completed project.

articles.title: DPRK Has Rosy Future:  Lao Figure
articles.content:
DPRK Has Rosy Future:  Lao Figure
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) --I was deeply impressed to visit the DPRK, said Sysay Leudedmounsone, president of the Central Committee of Lao Women's Union.
					 She had this to say:
					
					 It is my second visit to the DPRK. I was astonished to see the changed appearance of Pyongyang.
					
					  I was struck with admiration while enjoying a bird's-eye view of Pyongyang on the observation deck of the Tower of the Juche Idea.
					
					 The Korean people are dynamically stepping up the building of a thriving nation.
					
					I was greatly encouraged to witness the struggle of the Korean people.
					
					 I was deeply impressed to visit Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill, the Changgwang Kindergarten and the Hana Music Information Center.
					
					 The Korean women are playing a great role in building a thriving nation.
					
					The party and the state spare nothing for the children, the future of the nation. 
					
					 The children of the DPRK are growing stoutly, bringing their talents into bloom under the loving care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I have seen the future of Korea on their faces.
					
					 Kim Jong Un is translating the behests of General Secretary Kim Jong Il into realities.
					
					 Rosy is the future of the DPRK as it holds the peerlessly great men in high esteem.
					
					 I am convinced that the Korean people will register great successes in the building of a thriving nation under the wise leadership of  Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Doctor's Degree Awarded to Scientist
articles.content:
Doctor's Degree Awarded to Scientist 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- A doctorate of engineering was conferred upon Ri Chun Hui, room chief of an industrial experimental institute of the Munphyong Smeltery.
					 The scientist succeeded in inventing active additives of great significance in developing the economy and improving the standard of the people's living.
					
					 She has worked hard for more than two decades, prompted by her single desire to contribute to the prosperity of the country with scientific research achievements. 
					
					 The above-said invention made it possible to use the low-grade anthracite and lean coal as fuel for industrial purposes and heating houses.
					
					 An awarding ceremony was held in Wonsan City, Kangwon Province on Wednesday.

articles.title: National Sports Contest of School Youth and Children Opens
articles.content:
National Sports Contest of School Youth and Children Opens 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The 38th National Sports Contest of School Youth and Children for Jongilbong Prize was opened in the DPRK. 
					 It brought together more than 5 000 school youth and children selected from every province of the country. The contest is divided into groups of secondary and primary schools. The participants will compete in 30 odd events including Taekwon-Do, basketball, volleyball and table tennis. 
					
					 Its opening ceremony took place at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street here on Wednesday.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, made an opening address. 
					
					 At the end of the ceremony there were a demonstration of Taekwon-Do and a basketball match.

articles.title: Worker in Critical Condition Cured
articles.content:
Worker in Critical Condition Cured 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Medical workers of the South Phyongan Provincial People's Hospital completely cured in a matter of nearly 80 days Pak Chol Song, 26 year-old worker, who had been in a critical condition.
					 On February 25 he was carried to the hospital after being seriously burnt in an accident.
					
					 His life hang by a thread as he got second-third degree burns on 60 percent of his body.
					
					 The staff of the hospital organized a team to treat the patient shocked by third degree burn.
					
					 The medical workers held more than 20 consultative meetings. Intensive treatment went on day and night. 
					
					 He recovered his consciousness after three days and received the first skin graft operation in 17 days.
					
					 More than 400 people donated their blood and flesh to the patient. They included doctors and nurses of the hospital, officials and other employees of the factory where Pak works, teachers and students of Sinuiju Medical University. 
					
					 After the operations they showed all sincerity. They offered varieties of tonics and foodstuff.
					
					 It was thanks to the utmost sincerity and care of the medical staff group of the hospital and people that Pak could get fully cured and properly walk.
					
					 He was warmly seen off by everybody. 
					
					Pak and his family evinced their resolution to repay the loving care shown for him with successes in production, noting that while he was hospitalized, he keenly realized the benevolence of the party and the advantages of the socialist healthcare system.

articles.title: Afforestation Brisk in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Afforestation Brisk in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Greening and afforestation are making brisk headway in Pyongyang, turning the city more beautiful.
					 Pyongyangites planted more than 2,464,000 trees of good species including dawn redwood, zelkova and ginkgo in streets, parks and recreation grounds this spring.
					
					 On the significant Day of the Sun there appeared at least 600 flower stands and some 1,000 flower fields.
					
					 In a few days of this month, they planted hundreds of thousands of flower plants, turned a large area into greenery and carried out weeding in lawns of hundreds of hectares.

articles.title: Paints, Not Harmful to Eco-environment
articles.content:
Paints, Not Harmful to Eco-environment
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The "Hyonmu"-trademarked paints are widely applied to painting vessels and maritime structures in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Resistant to erosion and pollution in sea water, the paints settle in a short time. They prevent heat oxidation in steel structures.
					
					 The paints do not give adverse effect on eco-environment as they are made of natural minerals. Their advantages have been proven through sea-water tests and paintings on vessels and ground architectures from Juche 82 (1993) onward.
					
					 The paints were developed on the basis of analysis of the materials believed to have been used in the mural painting "Hyonmu" dating back to Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668).
					
					 According to Dr. So Tok Sam, the paints won a gold medal at the 22nd Geneva Exhibition of International Inventions and New Technologies held in April 1994.
					
					 The paints' maker is the Korean Hungsong Trading Company.

articles.title: Powerful Youth Construction Unit of DPRK
articles.content:
Powerful Youth Construction Unit of DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- A vigorous drive is now going on in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to spruce up the capital city of Pyongyang. Standing in the van of this undertaking is the Management Bureau of the Speed Campaign Youth Shock Brigade.
					 With its creditable building forces and equipment, the Bureau had finished building apartment structures in the Mansudae area ahead of other units and is now giving a final touch to the projects.
					
					 Organized on May 16, Juche 64 (1975) on the initiative of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, this unit has performed praiseworthy feats in construction projects over the past 30 years. 
					
					 Young builders made signal achievements in building revolutionary sites in Mt. Paektu, Lake Samji, Mt. Wangjae and Oun-dong and took a lion's share in erecting Kim Il Sung Square, the Grand People's Study House, International Friendship Exhibition House, Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace and other monumental edifices.
					
					 They also played a positive role in laying Manpho-Hyesan Youth Railway, electrifying railways and building major industrial establishments, including the East Pyongyang Thermal Power Plant.
					
					 Their great feats are associated with apartment buildings in different streets of Pyongyang, the Changgwang Health Complex, the Pyongyang Ophthalmology Hospital and other welfare and medical service establishments. 
					
					 Awarded Order of Kim Il Sung, the Bureau boasts of tens of thousands of recipients of state orders, including the Title of Labor Hero.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's History of Love for People Continues in DPRK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's History of Love for People Continues in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- It was General Secretary Kim Jong Il's noble outlook on the people that the masses are almighty and the Korean people are great.
					 With this outlook he had devoted all his life to the people's happiness.
					
					 His history of love for the people steadily continues in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, thanks to the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 When visiting a machine plant, Kim Jong Un acquainted himself in detail with the supply service for its employees and said that there is nothing to spare for the workers, scientists and technicians and the officials should take good care of their living before production.
					
					 He also toured the Kangsong Health Complex, newly built at the plant, to learn about all facilities to be used by its employees.
					
					 When visiting newly-built People's Theatre, he was very pleased to see the theatre furnished with all facilities including ultra-modern stages, rehearsal room, make-up room and welfare service amenities.
					
					 During his inspection of the Mangyongdae Funfair he personally plucked up weeds, grown between pavement blocks in its compound, one by one and scolded its officials, querying they could work like this if they had conscience to serve the people. He said that that occasion should be taken to issue a serious warning to the officials so that they can have proper spirit of serving the people.
					
					 All the servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK will push ahead with the grand onward march to build a thriving socialist country under the leadership of Kim Jong Un who has the noble view on the people that everything should be subordinated to them.

articles.title: U.S. Masterminds Suppression of Kwangju Popular Uprising in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Masterminds Suppression of Kwangju Popular Uprising in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- On May 18, 1980, students and other citizens in south Korea's Kwangju City turned out in a massive uprising for independence, democracy and reunification.
					 The uprising, in protest against the pro-American military fascist rule, swept 17 cities and counties in South Jolla Province and Jonju City in North Jolla Province, involving more than one million people.
					
					The uprisers drove out the martial forces from the city of Kwangju and defended the city from the attacks of crack contingent for ten days. 
					
					 However, the uprising suffered a failure by brutal crackdown of the military fascist clique, which was engineered by the United States, and the city turned into a "bath of blood".
					
					 At that time, the U.S. handed over to the military fascist clique puppet army divisions and military hardware under the U.S. forces commander in south Korea to quell the uprising.
					
					 According to south Korea's Yonhap Press in late February 1996, a predecessor of Yonhap News, the then commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea told in a meeting that he approved the move of the south Korean army's 20th Division into Kwangju.
					
					 The U.S. newspaper Journal of Commerce dated February 27, 1996 said the U.S. ambassador to south Korea, in a confidential message sent to the State Department on May 7, 1980, unveiled his intention to reinforce or replace the riot police with military troops by instigating the south Korean military. On May 9, he informed the south Korean authorities of the approval he won from the U.S. administration.
					
					 Backed by the United States, the south Korean military fascist clique mercilessly massacred the uprisers, regardless of sex and ages, saying "it is no bad to kill even 70 percent of the Kwangju citizens."
					
					 On no account, the U.S. can evade the blame for the Kwangju massacre.
					
					 The Kwangju Popular Uprising left a bitter lesson that it is impossible to achieve social progress and national unity and reunification as long as there remain in south Korea the U.S. forces and their followers, the traitors to the nation.
					
					 The Koreans will get closely united under the banner of independent reunification to drive the U.S. imperialist aggression forces out of south Korea and realize the cherished desire for national reunification without fail.

articles.title: Revival of Yusin Dictatorship Should Not Be Allowed: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Revival of Yusin Dictatorship Should Not Be Allowed: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The revival of yusin dictatorship should not be allowed, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article carried 51 years after the bloody coup staged by the Park Chung-hee military fascist junta on May 16, 1961 under the wire-pulling of the U.S. imperialists.
					 Referring to the crimes committed by traitor Park, the article says: No sooner had he wrested power than declared anti-communism as a state policy, crying out for the "elimination of pro-communism," and stepped up the fascistization of society, turning the whole of south Korea into a living hell. Moreover, he earned an ill fame for escalating the north-south confrontation and reducing the south Korean people to slaves of foreign monopoly capital.
					
					 He sold off the country and its people to foreign forces, killed a large number of patriotic figures and guiltless people by enforcing dictatorial politics and brutally suppressed every movement for national reunification. Nothing can hide the crimes committed by the yusin dictator. They can never be written off no matter how much water may flow under the bridge. The above-said dictator met a miserable end for having reduced south Korea to a dreadful living hell through his horrible fascist rule.
					
					 More than 30 years have passed since that time. But the remnants of yusin dictatorship are shameless enough to project Park's daughter Park Geun Hye in a bid to advertise the "yusin regime's" "merits" and gratify the greed for power. 
					
					 Lurking behind this is an ulterior motive of the "Saenuri Party" to make "Park Chung-hee's perfume" scent the air in a bid to rally conservative forces and stay in power.
					
					 It is nothing but a daydream to try to get something by embellishing the hateful yusin dictatorship and reviving it.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Move to Institute War Constitution Assailed
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Move to Institute War Constitution Assailed 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The Liberal Democratic Party of Japan in its recent Executive Council meeting formally approved the amendment to the Constitution which calls for renaming the "Self-Defense Forces" "National Defense Forces", making the "Hinomaru" and "Kimigayo" Japan's national flag and national anthem and designating the Japanese emperor "head of state". If the amendment is adopted after getting the government's approval and presented to the Diet, this will mean that Japan will give up "its Pacifist Constitution" for good which has been in force since 1947 and have a war constitution instead. 
					  Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This indicates that the Japanese reactionaries' moves to replace the present Constitution by a war constitution have entered into a full-fledged phase. 
					
					 It is the invariable intention of the Japanese reactionaries to realize the ambition for overseas invasion at any cost by providing a constitutional guarantee for the revival of militarism. 
					
					 The Japan "Pacifist Constitution" may be replaced by a war constitution any time. 
					
					 Now the revival of militarism in Japan is not something that may happen in the future but a potential danger to the international community. 
					
					 The militarist chariot is now running at full speed for reinvasion. 
					
					 But there is something the Japanese reactionaries should bear in mind before trying hard to revive militarism, come what may. That is the old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" of the Japanese imperialists is nothing but a daydream as it can never come true. 
					
					 As proved by its past history, militarism brought Japan only a bitter defeat and ruin and the disgrace of being a war criminal state. Anachronistic is the attempt of Japan to revive militarism.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on DPRK's Dignity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on DPRK's Dignity
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Eye-opening change that has taken place in the destiny of the Korean nation is the necessity of the history provided by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the pioneers and the leaders of the Songun revolution, to which they dedicated all their lives. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The article goes on:  Korea today is no longer a weak country which used to be in the past when it fell victim to the competition among big powers for their domination but turned into a political and military power. The Korean people have demonstrated their dignity as an independent people whom no one dares provoke.
					
					 The peerlessly great men authored many famous works and advanced propositions related to the Songun idea and politics that Songun is the only way for the DPRK to follow and led the arduous and difficult Songun revolution.
					
					 The Songun revolution pioneered and led by the President and Kim Jong Il could prove to be a revolution with its victory promised because it reflected the requirements of the era and embodied the scientific truth of the struggle for carving out the destiny of the popular masses.
					
					 The lives of the President and Kim Jong Il were totally dedicated to the Songun revolution.
					
					 A dramatic turn took place in the destiny of the Korean people thanks to the Songun revolution pioneered by the peerlessly great men with their indomitable will.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists could turn Korea into its complete colony, availing themselves of the competition among powers for their domination in the past but the DPRK remains unfazed in face of any threat of united actions by the U.S. imperialists styling themselves "the world's only superpower" and their allies.
					
					 The DPRK today built by the peerlessly great persons will shed more resplendent rays under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, another great sun of Songun.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket under Fire
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket under Fire 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors recently let loose extremely provocative remarks that if the DPRK is not willing to give up its will to develop nukes and missiles, south Korea should "go in the direction of focusing on the regime change in the north."
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a bylined article in this regard: This brings to light the bellicose intention of the Lee group not to rule out even a war of aggression, persistently standing against the DPRK. 
					
					 It goes on: 
					
					The evermore reckless moves of the Lee group to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen cannot be interpreted apart from the abyss of ruin it is now finding itself. 
					
					 By escalating the tension to an extreme phase through its noisier anti-DPRK confrontation racket the group of traitors seeks to divert elsewhere the attention of the angry people and prolong its remaining days at any cost. 
					
					 Its confrontation racket is also a product of its blind pursuance of the hostile policy of outside forces. 
					
					 It is the sinister scenario of the U.S. to ignite a war by further bedeviling the north-south relations and realize its ambition for invading the DPRK by using south Korean puppet forces as bullet-shields. 
					
					 The Lee group whose fate is no better than fallen leaves is seeking a way out in zealously following the outside forces' policy of war of aggression against the DPRK. 
					
					 It is necessary to throw overboard as early as possible the Lee group in order to protect the peace of the country and the security of the nation as it is going reckless for confrontation and war.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Ridicules Japanese Reactionaries' Disgusting Behavior
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Ridicules Japanese Reactionaries' Disgusting Behavior
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Japanese diplomats including the consul general in New York met with the mayor of a city in New Jersey State of the U.S. and implored him to remove the monument to comfort women for Imperial Japanese Army standing in front of the city library. They offered even fund for the development of the city while making this suggestion. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is disgusting behavior of brazen-faced guys who neither feel shame nor know anything about ethics and morality. 
					
					 The despicable moves of the Japanese reactionaries to write off their crime-woven past history through bribery are an unpardonable insult to the Asian people including the Korean people and the challenge to the human conscience.
					
					 The sexual slavery for Imperial Japanese Army is the thrice-cursed crime committed in the 20th century. It is the hideous crime against humanity unprecedented in the history of the imperialists' wars of aggression. Therefore, no statute of limitation is applicable to this crime. There should be only honest apology and reparation from the Japanese government.
					
					 A resolution on the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army was adopted at the U.S. House of Representatives. Even the street called Comfort Women Street was reported to appear in New York City. It is needless to say that this reflected humankind's will not to pardon such crime as sexual slavery.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the Japanese reactionaries are foolish enough to have a bargaining over history as mentioned above. 
					
					 The suggestion made by Japanese diplomats for the removal of the monument turned down by the above-said mayor indicates that any move to tamper with history is intolerable at any place at present. The Japanese reactionaries are sadly mistaken if they calculate the world people would be taken in by the above-said cunning and childish method to write off the crime-woven history by bribery.
					
					 Sincere apology and reparation for their past crimes are not something for others but for the good of Japan.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces to Stage North-targeted War Drills
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces to Stage North-targeted War Drills
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The 65th Division of the south Korean puppet forces announced that it would stage 2012 Ssangryong exercises in the areas of Yangju, Tongduchon and Phaju of Kyonggi Province from May 16 to 18, according to Yonhap News of south Korea. 
					 Tactical air force, tanks and artillery pieces and other offensive weaponry and latest military equipment will be involved in the military drills aimed to help the standing forces and reserve troops perform their duties and increase the maneuverability of units under the simulated conditions of an actual war, etc.
					
					Ssangryong drills started in 1977 with its main objective to hurl reserve forces into forward operation theatres after reorganizing them to suit the battle conditions.
					
					 After seizure of power the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors increased the duty of the reserve troops in such a way as to undertake more belligerent civil operations with main emphasis on establishing a rule over the occupied areas of the DPRK and has since conducted more offensive saber-rattling targeted against it.
					
					 This clearly suggests the danger of Ssangryong drills in the light of the fact that civil operation was an important program whenever north-targeted large-scale war exercises such as Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills kicked off.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Boosting Military Cooperation with Japan
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Boosting Military Cooperation with Japan
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations of south Korea including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification on May 12 held a rally in Seoul condemning the puppet group of traitors for its hectic diplomacy to conclude military agreements with Japan.
					 Speakers at the rally assailed Japan for refusing to apologize and compensate for its past crimes including issue of comfort women while working with bloodshot eyes to grab Tok Islets.
					
					 Nevertheless, the authorities regard Japan as a partner with which they can have military cooperation and are getting busy making arrangements for signing military agreements which no preceding dictator has ever ventured to do so, taking advantage of the situation where the 19th term  "National Assembly" has not yet been formed, they deplored, and continued: 
					
					 Such situation is attributable to the fact that the descendants of pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese elements are still at large.
					
					 The authorities should not be allowed to bring into this land the military forces of Japan under any circumstances.
					
					 They called for coming out against the conclusion of any military agreement with Japan and the formation of a triangular military alliance involving south Korea, the U.S. and Japan and bringing down the sycophantic regime bereft of national self-esteem.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Clamping down Progressive Media
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Clamping down Progressive Media
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. issued a statement on May 11 denouncing the south Korean puppet group for kicking off a campaign to suppress progressive media.
					 The statement condemned the puppet prosecution for detaining Han Song, a journalist of the Internet paper Jaju Minbo, in the wake of arrest of its representative Ri Chang Gi. 
					
					 Han conducted his just media activities to disclose the injustice of the authorities' anti-DPRK confrontation policy and explain the significance and importance of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, the statement said.
					
					 The statement deplored that to voice opposition to war and express desire for peace and reunification is punishable in south Korean society.
					
					 The prosecution playing the role of a hunting dog of the Lee's regime denounced for being traitors to the nation is bound to face a strong resistance of the people, it warned.
					
					 The statement demanded the prosecution make an apology to the people for its crimes, immediately release the journalists and guarantee Jaju Minbo legal and patriotic media activities.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Demand Stop to Import of American Beef
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Demand Stop to Import of American Beef 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The Seoul District Federation of University Students of south Korea held a press conference in Chonggye Square, Seoul on May 14 denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for ceaselessly importing American beef, while deceiving the people.
					 The organization in its press release accused the authorities of not stopping the import of the above-said beef, talking about its safety and the like though a mad cow disease occurred in the U.S.
					
					 Despite experts' unanimous view that the mad cow disease which occurred in the U.S. recently affects the life of the people, the investigation group dispatched by the regime returned even without visiting the afflicted farm, it noted.
					
					 It expressed irrepressible indignation at the Lee regime as it dispatched to the U.S. a tourists and visitors group, not an investigation group, spending money collected from people as taxes, refusing to keep a promise made to them that it would stop American beef import once a mad cow disease occurs in the U.S.
					
					 It threatened to launch a campaign for boycotting American beef centering around universities so as to censure the hypocritical policy of the regime and intensify the actions demanding a renegotiation over its import.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's August Name Displayed Throughout World
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's August Name Displayed Throughout World
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- An inaugural meeting for the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism took place in Tokyo on May 3.
					 Many streets, institutions and organizations of different countries have been named after President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The banana cultivator members of the People's Party of Costa Rica named their party cell after Kim Il Sung in 1945.
					
					 Since then his august name has been honored in many countries around the world.
					
					 In September 1976, a university street in the capital city of Maputo, Mozambique was named "Kim Il Sung Street" and in February 1982, the Kim Il Sung Library was opened in Morogoro City, Morogoro Region of Tanzania.
					
					 An unveiling ceremony for Kim Il Sung's statue took place at Jilin Yuwen Middle School in Jilin Province of China in October 1986 and the classroom where the President studied was named "Room in Commemoration of Comrade Kim Il Sung's Reading".
					
					 A kindergarten in Ovorhangay Province, Mongolia, was named "Kim Il Sung Kindergarten" on the occasion of his 80th birthday in 1992.
					
					 In Peru a Kim Il Sung Hall was built at the Faculty of Industrial Technology of Huacho National University while the Institute of Agricultural Science was renamed Kim Il Sung Agricultural Science Research Institute in Guinea. And, the Kim Il Sung Bookshop emerged in Madagascar.
					
					 Meanwhile, many Juche idea study organizations named after Kim Il Sung have been formed throughout the world since mid-1960s.
					
					 The International Kim Il Sung Prize Council was formed on the occasion of the President's 81st birthday. The Council made a decision to institute the International Kim Il Sung Prize, followed by establishment of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation in October 2007.
					
					 Institutes, organizations and buildings for the study of Kimilsungism were formed or built in many countries, including France, Syria, Sweden, Denmark, Mexico, Nepal, Zimbabwe, Pakistan, Mongolia, Benin and Mali.

articles.title: Koreans in Canada Denounce Lee Myung Bak's Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
Koreans in Canada Denounce Lee Myung Bak's Reckless Remarks 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The Canada Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and the Canada Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification Sunday made public a joint statement in denunciation of the reckless remarks made by traitor Lee Myung Bak slandering the legitimate satellite launch and nuclear test of the DPRK. 
					 The statement accused Lee of blustering that the north's nuclear deterrence for self-defence is intolerable. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities staged ceaseless large joint military exercises with the U.S., it said, adding: Not content with this, they hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership and system of the DPRK and defamed even the celebrations of the Day of the Sun, driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme pitch of tension. 
					
					 Lee Myung Bak should own responsibility for pushing the situation to the brink of war and make apology for this. 
					
					 It demanded Lee stop the suppression of the South Headquarters of Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification struggling for independent and peaceful reunification of the country and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Reported by Russian and Chinese Broadcasting Services
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Reported by Russian and Chinese Broadcasting Services
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation" was reported by a Russian radio broadcasting service and Phoenix Satellite TV Holdings LTD., Hong Kong, China on May 9.
					 The work published on April 27, 2012 indicates the general orientation and tasks for face-lifting the land of the country to fit for the appearance of a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: British Paper Lauds Kim Il Sung' Immortal Exploits
articles.content:
British Paper Lauds Kim Il Sung' Immortal Exploits
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Line of March, the organ of the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist), in its May issue carried a special write-up illustrated with photos of President Kim Il Sung.
					 It carried an account of events held in Britain with splendor to celebrate the centenary of President Kim Il Sung's birth as well as an article titled "Heritage of Comrade Kim Il Sung".
					
					 Kim Il Sung wisely led the anti- imperialist national liberation struggle, firmly defending the independence and sovereignty of the country and making an immortal contribution to the world revolution, the article said, adding:
					
					 He was the founder of the Workers' Party of Korea and socialist Korea and is eternal President of the DPRK.
					
					 Kim Il Sung embarked on the road of revolution in his teens and led the protracted Korean revolution to victory, thus building socialism centered on popular masses on the land of Korea.
					
					 He had received a total of more than 70,000 foreigners including heads of party, state and government of 136 countries in his lifetime.
					
					 He made tireless efforts for the country and revolution, people and world peace till the last moments of his life.
					
					 Socialist Korea, the legacy left over by Kim Il Sung, has grown strong under the outstanding Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The article expressed conviction that the Korean people would register greater successes in building a thriving socialist nation under the guidance of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, identical to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in idea, leadership and personality.

articles.title: Annual Meeting of Finland-Korea Society Held
articles.content:
Annual Meeting of Finland-Korea Society Held
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Finland-Korea Society was held in Helsinki on April 28.
					 It reviewed last year's activities of the society and discussed the orientation of the work to be done by it this year.
					
					 It decided to contribute to boosting the exchange, cooperation and friendly relations between the two peoples, the friendly organizations, in particular, with main emphasis on intensifying the activities for supporting the Korean people's just cause this year.
					
					 Antti Sika Aho was reelected chairman of the society at the meeting.

articles.title: Belgian King Hopes for Stronger Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Belgian King Hopes for Stronger Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Hyon Hak Bong, DPRK ambassador to Belgium, on May 9 presented his credentials to Albert II, King of Belgium.
					 The king said though Belgium and the DPRK are far away from each other geographically, they have great potential to cooperate in various fields, adding that Belgium hopes for further development of the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries.
					
					 He also expressed hope that the tensions would be defused on the Korean Peninsula and the north-south relations would improve.

articles.title: Okinawans Stage Demo in Demand of Closure of Futenma Air Base
articles.content:
Okinawans Stage Demo in Demand of Closure of Futenma Air Base 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- About 2 700 demonstrators marched Sunday around the U.S. Marines Futenma Air Base in Ginowan City, Okinawa.
					 They demanded an immediate closure and transfer of the airfield outside of the prefecture.

articles.title: Four NATO Soldiers Killed in Southern Afghanistan
articles.content:
Four NATO Soldiers Killed in Southern Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Four NATO soldiers lost their lives at separate incidents in southern Afghanistan on May 12.
					 The death of the four soldiers made more than 150 NATO soldiers killed so far this year in Afghanistan.

articles.title: Iran's IRGC Ground Forces to Hold Military Drill
articles.content:
Iran's IRGC Ground Forces to Hold Military Drill
 Tehran, May 15 (KCNA) -- A senior Iranian commander said on Sunday that the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Ground Forces plan to hold three-day massive military maneuvers in northeastern parts of the country, the local satellite Press TV reported.
					 "This military drill, dubbed Ja'far Tayyar, will be held with the purpose of maintaining the preparedness and promoting the combat capability of the units stationed in the region," deputy commander for operation of the IRGC Ground Forces Gholam-Ali Gholamian was quoted as saying.
					
					 The three-day drill would open in Iran's eastern province of South Khorasan on Monday.

articles.title: Conversan Kim Yong Nam y Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono
articles.content:
Conversan Kim Yong Nam y Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono
Yakarta, 15 de mayo (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 15 en el Palacio Presidencial en esta capital las conversaciones entre el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, y el presidente de la Republica de Indonesia, Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono.
					En la ocasion, ambas partes intercambiaron criterios sobre la ampliacion y desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y otros problemas de interes mutuo y discutieron los problemas para intensificar en las escenas internacionales la cooperacion y la solidaridad.
					
					La parte coreana subrayo que ha enaltecido al querido camarada Kim Jong Un como Maximo Dirigente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Estado, celebro solemnemente el centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung y acelera energicamente la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista.
					
					Expreso la voluntad de consolidar y desarrollar aun mas las relaciones entre los dos paises y ampliar la cooperacion en los dominios de economia, cultura, deporte, salud publica y otros.
					
					La parte indonesia menciono que las relaciones entre los dos paises tienen una larga tradicion historica y estos vinieron desarrollando la amistad bilateral en el principio de respeto a la soberania, cooperacion y beneficio mutuo.
					
					Enfatizo que Indonesia ampliara la cooperacion multilateral con Corea y colaborara con ella en ASEAN y el MNOAL.
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente amistoso.
					
					Participaron aqui por la parte coreana el presidente del Comite de Empresas Asociadas e Inversiones Ri Kwang Gun, el ministro de Industria Ligera An Jong Su, el embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC acreditado en Indonesia Ri Jong Ryul y otros miembros de la comitiva y por la indonesa, el ministro coordinador para los asuntos politico, juridico y de seguridad, Djoko Suyanto, el ministro coordinador para los asuntos economicos, Hatta Radjasa, el ministro coordinador para el bienestar del pueblo, Agung Lasono, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Raden Mohammad Marty Muliana Natalegawa, el ministro de Comercio, Gita Wirjawwan, el ministro de Industria, Mohammad Suleman Hidayat, y el embajador indonesio en la RPDC, Nasri Gustaman, y otros relacionados.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con autoridades de Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con autoridades de Indonesia
Yakarta, 15 de mayo (Corresponsal de la ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, quien realiza una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica de Indonesia, departio el martes en un ambiente amistoso con el vicepresidente indonesio Boediono.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion Ri Kwang Gun, presidente del Comite de Empresas Asociadas e Inversiones, An Jong Su, ministro de Industria Ligera, Ri Jong Ryul, embajador coreano en Indonesia, y otros acompanantes.
					
					Tambien tomaron parte Mohammad Umar, secretario del vicepresidente, Gita Wirjawwan, ministro de Comercio, Nasri Gustaman, embajador indonesio en la RPDC, y las personalidades interesadas.
					
					En la ocasion, Boediono dijo que aprecia mucho el hecho de que el pueblo coreano sigue marchando por la senda escogida por si mismo bajo la orientacion de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un.
					
					Manifesto la voluntad de intensificar la colaboracion con el pueblo coreano, viejo amigo.
					
					Este dia, Kim Yong Nam converso por separado en una atmosfera cordial con Taufiq Kiemas, presidente de la Asamblea Consultiva del Pueblo, y Marzuki Alie, presidente de la Camara de Representantes del Pueblo.
					
					Taufiq Kiemas destaco que la RPDC es el pais que logra su desarrollo segun su propia linea.
					
					Manifesto la conviccion de que se activara la cooperacion economica entre ambos paises que tienen largas relaciones historicas.
					
					Deseo buena salud a Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un, Maximo Dirigente del PTC y el pueblo coreano.
					
					Marzuki Alie recalco que deviene un gran orgullo para el pueblo coreano tener a Su Excelencia      Kim Jong Un en el puesto cimero del partido y el Estado.
					
					Expreso la esperanza de que se consoliden y se desarrollen las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Tiene lugar en Indonesia ceremonia de bienvenida a Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Tiene lugar en Indonesia ceremonia de bienvenida a Kim Yong Nam
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el martes en el Palacio Presidencial de Indonesia la ceremonia de bienvenida a Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion Kim Yong Nam, Ri Kwang Gun, presidente del Comite de Empresas Asociadas e Inversiones, An Jong Su, ministro de Industria Ligera, Ri Jong Ryul, embajador coreano en Indonesia, y otros acompanantes.
					
					Participaron tambien el presidente Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, el ministro coordinador para los Asuntos Politico, Juridico y de Seguridad, Djoko Suyanto, el ministro coordinador para los Asuntos Economicos, Hatta Radjasa, el ministro coordinador para el Bienestar del Pueblo, Agung Lasono, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Raden Mohammad Marty Muliana Natalegawa, el ministro de Defensa, Purnomo Yusgiantoro, el ministro de Comercio, Gita Wirjawwan, el ministro de Industria, Mohammad Suleman Hidayat, el comandante en jefe del Ejercito Nacional Indonesio, los jefes de Estado Mayor de las Fuerzas Terrestres, Navales y Aereas, el comandante de la policia y el embajador indonesio en la RPDC, Nasri Gustaman. 
					
					Kim Yong Nam paso revista a la guardia de honor del Ejercito Nacional Indonesio.

articles.title: Premier coreano recorre el Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae
articles.content:
Premier coreano recorre el Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, estudio la vispera en el terreno las gestiones del Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae.
					La clase obrera del Complejo logra exitos en la modernizacion de su empresa y la produccion de rieles pesados en acato al legado del Dirigente     Kim Jong Il.
					
					Recorriendo el proceso de generacion de gas y el de calentamiento por combustion de aire bajo altas temperaturas y otros puntos, el premier se cercioro detalladamente del estado de reconstruccion del complejo y convoco una reunion consultiva.
					
					En la ocasion hubo debates sobre la materializacion de la politica del partido para modernizar el ferrocarril y aplicar rieles pesados en este sector, la reconstruccion del complejo y la normalizacion en alto nivel de la produccion de rieles, y se impartieron a las unidades relacionadas las tareas para proveer de suficientes materias primas y materiales.
					
					Choe averiguo la situacion del albergue de los obreros y de las labores de autoabastecimiento.
					
					Puntualizo que todos los funcionarios deben asegurar al maximo el confort de los obreros al aprender la noble concepcion del pueblo del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, y atender bien las condiciones de vida de ellos, y tomo las medidas para concluir pronto la construccion de viviendas.
					
					Ese dia, el visito la XV Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Primaveral de Pyongyang resaltando la necesidad de dinamizar la cooperacion bilateral y multilateral entre los paises y regiones en el area economica y comercial.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae recorre lugar de construccion de parque folclorico
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae recorre lugar de construccion de parque folclorico
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ACNC) -- Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, averiguo en el terreno el martes el estado de la construccion del Parque Folclorico de Pyongyang en etapa final.
					Este parque entrana el noble proposito de los grandes hombres sin iguales del monte Paektu de ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida cultural al pueblo coreano apreciando las tradiciones folcloricas.
					
					Choe se informo en detalles de como marcha la obra recorriendo varios puntos.
					
					Estimulo a los constructores militares quienes crean innovaciones cada dia ateniendose a las instrucciones dadas en el terreno por el Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Un.
					
					Destaco la necesidad de construir bien las miniaturas de las creaciones monumentales de la epoca del PTC y las famosas ruinas y objetos historicos manteniendo sus formas originales y acondicionar excelentes areas verdes.
					
					Choe llamo a todos los constructores militares a cumplir en el maximo nivel la construccion del parque que propuso el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y presta mucha atencion el Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Terminadas en Corea obras relacionadas con marisma
articles.content:
Terminadas en Corea obras relacionadas con marisma
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ACNC) -- Terminaron ya la roturacion de segunda etapa de marisma de Kwaksan y la obra de la red interior de marisma de Taegyedo.
					Los obreros y los funcionarios del Complejo de Roturacion de Marismas de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte roturaron en un ano y pico mil 600 hectareas de marisma al levantar malecon de miles de metros que enlaza las islas Kwan, Talyang, Oejang, Naejang y otras.
					
					La terminacion de las obras garantiza el cultivo seguro de la granja de gran tamano, la cria de pez y el cultivo maritimo, de manera que se han alcanzado notables avances en el desarrollo de la agricultura del pais y la mejora de vida del pueblo y el territorio patrio cambio de su fisonomia.
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 16 en el terreno la ceremonia inaugural.
					
					A la ocasion asistieron Choe Yong Rim, Ro Tu Chol y otros funcionarios, los funcionarios y los constructores de dicho Complejo y los trabajadores del distrito de Kwaksan.
					
					Se dio lectura a la carta de agradecimiento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea dirigida a los constructores, funcionarios, cientificos y tecnicos quienes realizaron meritos laborales en la roturacion de la segunda etapa de marisma de Kwaksan.
					
					En la carta, el CC del PTC evaluo altamente que todos los constructores, funcionarios, cientificos y tecnicos, participantes en esta obra edificaron con excelencia la otra creacion monumental que transmitira eternamente con la epoca del Songun, manifestando de pleno despliegue el heroismo masivo y la abnegacion incomparable.
					
					Terminada la ceremonia, los participantes recorrieron varios puntos de la obra.
